text: Yeah I wasn't seeing anything on the HubL supported variables page at a quick glance but was able to find the above option by using Developer Info (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/how-to-use-developer-info-on-cos-pages>) and then testing that variable in my own portal.
anyone ever tried using the |escapejs filter with a text field in a custom module? I’m trying to let something be editable, but an apostrophe is breaking the JS.
<@U6GNQ7JBU> not sure if escapejs got fully resolved or not
I had some issues with it, didn’t do what I expected it to do
yeah, that’s where I’m sitting right now as well
There is an issue with some of the escaped characters because of the parsing library we use reconverts the escaped characters back into their unescaped form
I think we worked around the issue on our end by using |replace to manually escape characters. not a good longterm solution but good in a pinch
can we pass things like data-toggle and data target to {% cta guid="" %}
